page.title: 16LUDLOW - A TOURIST TOWN
page.content: Tourists from home and abroad are attracted by the historic buildings of Ludlow and the surrounding countryside. Whitcliffe common offers a wide view of the town and there is fishing and boating on the River Teme. Ludlow has examples of many periods of architecture - Ludlow Castle,where a Shakespearean play is performed every summer,the Feathers Hotel,St. Lawrences church,Georgian buildings in Mill street and a Victorian Town Hall. Perhaps the most famous street in Ludlow is Broad Street with the Butter cross at the top and Broadgate at the bottom. Many people come to Ludlow to study the famous Geological Fossil trail in nearby Mortimer Forest as well as a base for walking South Shropshire hills.
